content: It has happened twice to me that I did a perf run on a PR, then did lots of reviews, and totally forgot about the perf and merged the PR. How about we teach bors to reject r+ if there is the regression label but no regression-triaged label?

Potentially we could go as far as requiring a label that a perf run has been done or the reviewer added the label manually because they did not consider it necessary (anything you would rollup without looking twice)
The perf-regression (vs. perf-regression-triaged) label is potentially something you can use today for this, before approving
Oh heh, it did seem like something that others should've already come up with, thanks for the link!
